Donald Rumsfeld asserts that the harsh interrogation tactics he authorized for use against high-value terrorism suspects helped U.S. authorities save lives, including in the case of Mohammed al-Qahtani . Qahtani, who was the 20th hijacker, they say-- he gave a lot of information, Donald Rumsfeld said. "And it was very helpful to our interrogators and to the United States government in saving lives." bonds to Social Security, guaranteeing repayment with interest. Social Security supporters are adamant that the program will be repaid, just as the U.S. government repays others who invest in U.S. Treasury bonds. It's an IOU that is backed by Treasury bonds and the faith and credit of the United States government, said Barack Obama Sen. Bernie Sanders , I-Vt. Asked whether he planned to stay another four years at Google to collect stock awards worth$ 100 million, Eric Schmidt said: Yes, that is my plan. Google said last month co-founder Larry Page would take over as chief executive from April 4 while Eric Schmidt would assume the role of executive chairman.

attention. Heart disease is a serious problem, especially for women, who tend not to get the right care. "Take advantage of the technology and care that's available," David Letterman says.
